title: Authors and Citation
text: Pereira R (2023). censobr: Download Data Brazil's Population Census. https://github.com/ipeaGIT/censobr, https://ipeagit.github.io/censobr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {censobr: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census},   author = {Rafael H. M. Pereira},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/ipeaGIT/censobr, https://ipeagit.github.io/censobr/}, }

what: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
title: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
text: censobr R package download data Brazil’s Population Census. package still development. Currently, includes microdata 2010 population census. package expanded include years data sets.

title: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
code: # or use the development version with latest features   utils::remove.packages('censobr')   devtools::install_github("ipeaGIT/censobr")

title: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
text: package currently includes 3 main functions download Census microdata: read_population() read_households() read_deaths() syntax censobr functions operate logic becomes intuitive download data set using single line code. Like :
code: dfh <- read_households(           year,          # year of reference           columns,       # whether to return only selected columns           as_data_frame, # whether to return an Arrow table or a data.frame           showProgress,  # whether to show a download progress bar           cache          # whether to cahce data suring R session          )

title: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
text: Microdata Brazilian census might big load users’ RAM memory. avoid problem, censobr default return Arrow table, can analyzed like regular data.frame using dplyr package without loading full data memory. example calcuates average rent state. case users want output data.frame, though, can pass parameter as_data_frame = TRUE.
code: dfh |> group_by(V0001) |>   summarize(mean_rent = weighted.mean(x=V2011, w=V0010, na.rm = TRUE))

title: Download Data from Brazil's Population Census
text: Original data collected Brazilian Institute Geography Statistics (IBGE). censobr package developed team Institute Applied Economic Research (Ipea), Brazil.

title: Download file from url — download_file
text: Download file url

title: Download file from url — download_file
code: download_file(   file_url = parent.frame()$file_url,   showProgress = parent.frame()$showProgress,   cache = parent.frame()$cache )

title: Download file from url — download_file
text: file_url String. url. showProgress Logical. cache Logical.

title: Download file from url — download_file
text: string address file tempdir

title: Download file from url — download_file
code: if (FALSE)  if (interactive()) { # Generate url file_url <- 'https://github.com/ipeaGIT/censobr/releases/download/v0.0.1/2010_deaths.parquet'  # download data download_file(file_url = file_url,               showProgress = TRUE,               cache = TRUE) }

what: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
title: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
text: Download microdata death records Brazil's census.

title: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
code: read_deaths(   year = 2010,   columns = NULL,   as_data_frame = FALSE,   showProgress = TRUE,   cache = TRUE )

title: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
text: year Numeric. Year reference format yyyymm. Defaults 2010. columns String. vector column names keep. rest columns read. Defaults NULL read columns. as_data_frame Logical. Whether function return data.frame Arrow Table (Default). showProgress Logical. Defaults TRUE display download progress bar. progress bar reflects downloading time, time load data memory. cache Logical. Whether function read data cached locally future calls, much faster. Defaults TRUE. FALSE, function download file internet.

title: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
text: Arrow table "data.frame" object.

title: Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census — read_deaths
code: if (FALSE)  if (interactive()) { # return data as arrow table df <- read_deaths(year = 2010) head(df)  # # return data as data.frame # df <- read_deaths(year = 2010, as_data_frame = TRUE) # head(df) }
